dad: Because it saw the soy sauce!
What do you call fake sushi?
Why did the rice ball get invited everywhere?
Because it was on a roll!
wordplay: What did Mount Fuji say to the hill?
anime: Why did the anime character bring a ladder?
dajare: What do you call a pond in Japan?
Why was the Japanese bread so polite?
Because it always said 'pan'—and then bowed. (pan = bread)
Why did the frog move to Tokyo?
It heard it was a great place to 'kaeru'. (kaeru = to return / frog)
Why did the person bring 'hashi' to dinner?
Because without hashi, you can’t 'bridge' the meal. (hashi = chopsticks / bridge)
Why was the meeting so fast?
everyday_jp: Why do convenience stores feel like magic?
Because you walk in for one thing and leave with a whole bento adventure.
Why do trains in Japan feel so trustworthy?
Because even the doors are like: 'sumimasen'—we’re right on time.
Why is the umbrella the real main character in Japan?
Because it shows up the moment the forecast says 'maybe'.
Why do Japanese vending machines feel like friendly NPCs?
They’re everywhere, always helpful, and never judge your late-night tea choice.
